dct_title_s: Oudh and adjacent districts : compiled from materials in the Office of the Surveyor-General of India and corrected, where practi
dct_description_sm: Cartographic Details: Scale [1:506,880]. Military map of the state of Oudh, India [i.e. Uttar Pradesh] and its surrounding states in Northern India. The map is detailed with many cities and towns including the rail and road network available in 1848. It was reproduced 10 years at the time of the Indian Mutiny, when strategic movement of British troops was vital to quell the uprisings in Delhi, Lucknow, Cawnpoor [i.e. Kanpur], and Allahabad over the period 1857 and 1858. Dimensions: 89.8 x 74.8 centimeters
dct_creator_sm: Great Britain. Surveyor General of India.
dct_publisher_sm: Lithographed at the Ordnance Survey Office, under the direction of Lieut. Col. Cameron, Col. James, Superintendent
dcat_keyword_sm: Military Topography India Uttar Pradesh Maps
